page.title: 12WOLSTON FIRST SCHOOL FAYRE
page.content: After the 1985{May Fayre,}children wrote "I won a jelly on the tombola and some sweets on hook-a-duck. I had a ride on a pony and went on the bouncing castle four times. I was also selling cakes and sweets which we had made in school and we took Â£21" "I had a good time at the May Fayre. I had a go on the{tombola}and won some Pomagne." "There was a{tin-can-alley.} One of our dad's put tins on top of each other in a pattern, then we had to try to knock them down with three beanbags. If you did it you got your money back." "There were two Police cars and an ambulance to look at and have a go on their sirens and loudspeakers. There was a wedding in Church and people were wondering if some disaster had taken place because of the noise!"{Children}ran a stall to guess the number of sweets in a jar.
